context_bundle.summary: Docker Compose multi-container orchestration: define services in docker-compose.yml with services, networks, volumes. Each service: image or build, ports, environment, depends_on, volumes. Commands: docker-compose up (start), docker-compose down (stop/remove), docker-compose logs, docker-compose ps. Networks connect containers. Volumes persist data. Use .env for secrets. Version 3.x syntax: version: '3.8'.

onboarding.quick_start: Docker Compose file structure: version: '3.8', services: web: image: nginx:latest, ports: ['80:80'], db: image: postgres:13, environment: POSTGRES_PASSWORD: secret, volumes: ['db_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data'], volumes: db_data: {}. Commands: docker-compose up -d (detached), docker-compose down (stop and remove), docker-compose logs -f web (follow logs), docker-compose exec web bash (enter container). Networks: default network created, or custom: networks: frontend: {}. Build: build: ./app or build: {context: ., dockerfile: Dockerfile.dev}.
common_patterns: Basic service: services: web: image: nginx:latest, ports: ['80:80']
Build from Dockerfile: build: ./app or build: {context: ., dockerfile: Dockerfile}
